com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.data_analytics

Interface IAnalyticsTechnologyModule

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAnalyticsTechnologyService

    public interface IAnalyticsTechnologyModule
    Defines the interface of a module capable of performing batch or streaming processing via internal or external functions
    Author:
    acp

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean applyNodeAffinity(DataBucketBean completed_bucket, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Determines whether the job should be sent to (a) random node(s) every time (cardinality depending on multi_node_enabled/node_rules), or will "stick" with whatever nodes first process it.
      boolean canRunOnThisNode(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      This function should check the local environment, decide whether the technology module can run on this node (eg is the external software installed? are the environment variables set up correctly etc) and return true/false as quickly as possibly.
      FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<Boolean> checkAnalyticJobProgress(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_check, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Checks the job's progress: return true if complete, false if still going (optionally, "in progress" information can be returned via the management side-channel)
      FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<Boolean> checkCustomTrigger(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean trigger, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Users can set up custom triggers that are satisfied by arbitrary logic in the technology code (using the trigger fields for customization) This callback is called by the system at regular intervals
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onDeleteThread(DataBucketBean to_delete_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Notification that the bucket containing this analytic thread is being deleted.
      void onInit(IAnalyticsContext context)
      This function is guaranteed to always be called before any callback is called, and can therefore be used to store the context It can be used to store the context (which is always passed in anyway) and therefore set up any code that needs to be run.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onNewThread(DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context, boolean enabled)
      Handles a new thread being created - Note this notification does not mean that the thread should be started, (EXCEPT optionally for stream jobs when the bucket is active) ie it can usually just be "stubbed out" (but can be used for any required administrative actions/updating internal state etc) (That is handled via the a set of calls to startAnalyticJob (and notified via onThreadExecute)) This method is called for each analytic technology that is part of a thread
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onPeriodicPoll(DataBucketBean polled_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Periodic poll for statistics collection, health checks, etc.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onPurge(DataBucketBean purged_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Notification that all data for a bucket associated with this thread is to be purged Note that the actual purging is performed by the framework, so this is in case the state needs to be updated etc.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onTestThread(DataBucketBean test_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, ProcessingTestSpecBean test_spec, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Notifies this analytic thread that a job is about to start a test.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onThreadComplete(DataBucketBean completed_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      For batch type harvest technologies (eg file not streaming), this callback is called when a batch is complete.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onThreadExecute(DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, Collection<AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean> matching_triggers, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Invoked when an analytic bucket is triggered.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onUpdatedThread(DataBucketBean old_analytic_bucket, DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, boolean is_enabled, Optional<BucketDiffBean> diff, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Handles changes to an existing analytic thread - note this notification does not mean that the thread should be started, ie it can usually just be "stubbed out" (but can be used for any required administrative actions/updating internal state etc) (That is handled via the set of calls to startAnalyticJob (and notified via onThreadExecute)) This method is called for each analytic technology that is part of a thread If the thread is being suspended as part of the update, this callback has no responsibility for stopping anything, that will be handled by separate calls to suspendAnalyticJob (EXCEPT optionally for stream jobs when the bucket is active)
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> resumeAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_resume, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for re-activating the specified analytic job (which has previously been suspended) Normally suspend/resume will just call stop/start since most analytic platforms don't have explicit support for suspension/resumption
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> startAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_start, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for actually starting the specified analytic job
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> startAnalyticJobTest(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_test, ProcessingTestSpecBean test_spec, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Similar to startAnalyticJob, but with the knowledge this is only a test.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> stopAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_stop, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for actually stopping the specified analytic job (eg if the job is deleted)
      default boolean supportsMultiNode(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Whether this engine can be run in multi-node (defaults to false)
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> suspendAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_suspend, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for suspending the specified analytic job Normally suspend/resume will just call stop/start since most analytic platforms don't have explicit support for suspension/resumption

    • Method Detail

      • onInit

        void onInit(IAnalyticsContext context)
        This function is guaranteed to always be called before any callback is called, and can therefore be used to store the context It can be used to store the context (which is always passed in anyway) and therefore set up any code that needs to be run. It should return as quickly as possible, eg not block on any lengthy operations.
        Parameters:
        context - - the context for which an instance of this technology has been created

      • canRunOnThisNode

        boolean canRunOnThisNode(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                         Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                         IAnalyticsContext context)
        This function should check the local environment, decide whether the technology module can run on this node (eg is the external software installed? are the environment variables set up correctly etc) and return true/false as quickly as possibly. (Will often default to just 'return true;') This method is called for each analytic technology that is part of a thread
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread to check against (mostly this will be ignored, ie the function will just decide based on the technology module alone - but this enables the code to be cleverer, eg check the sub-modules as well)
        jobs - - the list of jobs from the analytic thread that this technology actually handles (mostly this will be ignored, ie the function will just decide based on the technology module alone - but this enables the code to be cleverer, eg check the sub-modules as well)
        Returns:
        true if this node can run this module's functionality

      • supportsMultiNode

        default boolean supportsMultiNode(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                                  Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                  IAnalyticsContext context)
        Whether this engine can be run in multi-node (defaults to false)
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread to check against (mostly this will be ignored, ie the function will just decide based on the technology module alone - but this enables the code to be cleverer, eg check the sub-modules as well)
        jobs - - the list of jobs from the analytic thread that this technology actually handles (mostly this will be ignored, ie the function will just decide based on the technology module alone - but this enables the code to be cleverer, eg check the sub-modules as well)
        Returns:
        true if this node can run this module's functionality

      • onNewThread

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onNewThread(DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket,
                                                Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                IAnalyticsContext context,
                                                boolean enabled)
        Handles a new thread being created - Note this notification does not mean that the thread should be started, (EXCEPT optionally for stream jobs when the bucket is active) ie it can usually just be "stubbed out" (but can be used for any required administrative actions/updating internal state etc) (That is handled via the a set of calls to startAnalyticJob (and notified via onThreadExecute)) This method is called for each analytic technology that is part of a thread
        Parameters:
        new_analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the new analytic thread
        jobs - - the list of jobs from the analytic thread that this technology actually handles (mostly this will be ignored, ie the function will just decide based on the technology module alone - but this enables the code to be cleverer, eg check the sub-modules as well)
        context - - the context available to this thread
        enabled - - whether the bucket is enabled
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • onUpdatedThread

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onUpdatedThread(DataBucketBean old_analytic_bucket,
                                                    DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket,
                                                    Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                    boolean is_enabled,
                                                    Optional<BucketDiffBean> diff,
                                                    IAnalyticsContext context)
        Handles changes to an existing analytic thread - note this notification does not mean that the thread should be started, ie it can usually just be "stubbed out" (but can be used for any required administrative actions/updating internal state etc) (That is handled via the set of calls to startAnalyticJob (and notified via onThreadExecute)) This method is called for each analytic technology that is part of a thread If the thread is being suspended as part of the update, this callback has no responsibility for stopping anything, that will be handled by separate calls to suspendAnalyticJob (EXCEPT optionally for stream jobs when the bucket is active)
        Parameters:
        old_analytic_bucket - - the old bucket containing the analytic thread
        new_analytic_bucket - - the new bucket containing the analytic thread
        jobs - - the list of jobs from the analytic thread that this technology actually handles (mostly this will be ignored, ie the function will just decide based on the technology module alone - but this enables the code to be cleverer, eg check the sub-modules as well)
        is_enabled - - whether the bucket is now enabled (note - you cannot infer anything about the previous enabled/suspended state unless the diff optional is present)
        diff - - optionally what information has changed (including changes to shared library beans). If this is not present (it will not be in early versions of the platform), developers must assume everything has changed, eg restarting the external service.
        context - - the context available to this thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • onDeleteThread

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onDeleteThread(DataBucketBean to_delete_analytic_bucket,
                                                   Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                   IAnalyticsContext context)
        Notification that the bucket containing this analytic thread is being deleted. The framework is responsible for removing all data associated with the bucket The framework will also call stopAnalyticJob for each active job, so this callback does not need to stop anything It is responsible for cleaning up any external state it might have generated (EXCEPT optionally for stream jobs, depending on the implementation)
        Parameters:
        to_delete_analytic_bucket - - the data bucket (containing this analytic thread) to be deleted
        jobs - - the list of jobs from the analytic thread that this technology actually handles (mostly this will be ignored, ie the function will just decide based on the technology module alone - but this enables the code to be cleverer, eg check the sub-modules as well)
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • checkCustomTrigger

        FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<Boolean> checkCustomTrigger(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                                                         AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean trigger,
                                                         IAnalyticsContext context)
        Users can set up custom triggers that are satisfied by arbitrary logic in the technology code (using the trigger fields for customization) This callback is called by the system at regular intervals
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread whose triggers are being examined
        trigger - - the specific trigger configuration to check against
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        a management future - true or false to fire the trigger, the side channel can be used to log errors

      • onThreadExecute

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onThreadExecute(DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket,
                                                    Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                    Collection<AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean> matching_triggers,
                                                    IAnalyticsContext context)
        Invoked when an analytic bucket is triggered. This callback should not start any jobs, that is handled by startAnalyticJob, so will not normally do much. (note the individual jobs will only execute if this callback returns a message bean with success==true)
        Parameters:
        new_analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread
        jobs - - the jobs within the analytic thread that are handled by this analytic technology
        matching_triggers - - a list of matching triggers (empty if it's a streaming job or a scheduled start)
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response - note the individual jobs will only execute if this returns success==true

      • onThreadComplete

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onThreadComplete(DataBucketBean completed_analytic_bucket,
                                                     Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                     IAnalyticsContext context)
        For batch type harvest technologies (eg file not streaming), this callback is called when a batch is complete. Normally no action is required from this callback
        Parameters:
        completed_analytic_bucket - The bucket whose batch has completed
        jobs - - the jobs within the analytic thread that are handled by this analytic technology
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • onPurge

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onPurge(DataBucketBean purged_analytic_bucket,
                                            Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                            IAnalyticsContext context)
        Notification that all data for a bucket associated with this thread is to be purged Note that the actual purging is performed by the framework, so this is in case the state needs to be updated etc.
        Parameters:
        purged_analytic_bucket - - the bucket that is being purged
        jobs - - the jobs within the analytic thread that are handled by this analytic technology
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • onPeriodicPoll

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onPeriodicPoll(DataBucketBean polled_analytic_bucket,
                                                   Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                   IAnalyticsContext context)
        Periodic poll for statistics collection, health checks, etc. The poll frequency is determined by the bucket
        Parameters:
        polled_analytic_bucket - The bucket containing the analytic thread being polled
        jobs - - the jobs within the analytic thread that are handled by this analytic technology
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • onTestThread

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> onTestThread(DataBucketBean test_bucket,
                                                 Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                 ProcessingTestSpecBean test_spec,
                                                 IAnalyticsContext context)
        Notifies this analytic thread that a job is about to start a test. The actual tests are invoked by startAnalyticJobTest, so this is just for setting up any persistent state etc, ie normally no action is required.
        Parameters:
        test_bucket - - the bucket to test
        jobs - - the jobs within the analytic thread that are handled by this analytic technology
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response (only completes when the test is complete)

      • startAnalyticJob

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> startAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                                                     Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                     AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_start,
                                                     IAnalyticsContext context)
        Responsible for actually starting the specified analytic job
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread that this job is part of
        jobs - - a list of all jobs handled by this thread
        job_to_start - - the specific job
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • stopAnalyticJob

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> stopAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                                                    Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                    AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_stop,
                                                    IAnalyticsContext context)
        Responsible for actually stopping the specified analytic job (eg if the job is deleted)
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread that this job is part of
        jobs - - a list of all jobs handled by this thread
        job_to_stop - - the specific job
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • resumeAnalyticJob

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> resumeAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                                                      Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                      AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_resume,
                                                      IAnalyticsContext context)
        Responsible for re-activating the specified analytic job (which has previously been suspended) Normally suspend/resume will just call stop/start since most analytic platforms don't have explicit support for suspension/resumption
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread that this job is part of
        jobs - - a list of all jobs handled by this thread
        job_to_resume - - the specific job
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • suspendAnalyticJob

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> suspendAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                                                       Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                       AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_suspend,
                                                       IAnalyticsContext context)
        Responsible for suspending the specified analytic job Normally suspend/resume will just call stop/start since most analytic platforms don't have explicit support for suspension/resumption
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread that this job is part of
        jobs - - a list of all jobs handled by this thread
        job_to_suspend - - the specific job
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • startAnalyticJobTest

        CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> startAnalyticJobTest(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                                                         Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                         AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_test,
                                                         ProcessingTestSpecBean test_spec,
                                                         IAnalyticsContext context)
        Similar to startAnalyticJob, but with the knowledge this is only a test. It isn't the callback's responsibility to ensure the processing test spec is respected, though it is welcome to as an extra piece of safety
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread that this job is part of
        jobs - - a list of all jobs handled by this thread
        job_to_test - - the specific job
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • checkAnalyticJobProgress

        FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<Boolean> checkAnalyticJobProgress(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket,
                                                               Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs,
                                                               AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_check,
                                                               IAnalyticsContext context)
        Checks the job's progress: return true if complete, false if still going (optionally, "in progress" information can be returned via the management side-channel)
        Parameters:
        analytic_bucket - - the bucket containing the analytic thread that this job is part of
        jobs - - a list of all jobs handled by this thread
        job_to_check - - the specific job
        context - - the context available to this analytic thread
        Returns:
        A future for the response

      • applyNodeAffinity

        default boolean applyNodeAffinity(DataBucketBean completed_bucket,
                                  IAnalyticsContext context)
        Determines whether the job should be sent to (a) random node(s) every time (cardinality depending on multi_node_enabled/node_rules), or will "stick" with whatever nodes first process it. Setting to "false" will improve the robustness when the underlying technology is fundamentally distributed (ie all you're doing is making an API call to an external service, vs launching a process on box) Defaults to (true for harvest technologies and) false for analytic technologies. IMPORTANT: If the completed_bucket does not have lock_to_nodes set OR contains a harvest_technology (ie is not a pure analytic thread) then should return the default Very odd and not necessarily easily recoverable results will occur if this is wrong, so beware of changing from the default unless you know what you're doing!
        Parameters:
        completed_bucket -
        context -
        Returns:
